title: Deskati
text:
Deskati () is a mountainous <a href="municipality">municipality</a> in the <a href="Grevena%20%28regional%20unit%29">Grevena regional unit</a>. The current municipality of Deskati was formed in 2011 by the merge of the former municipality of Deskati and the municipality of <a href="Chasia%2C%20Grevena">Chasia</a>. The main economic activities in Deskati are <a href="farming">farming</a> and <a href="animal%20husbandry">animal husbandry</a>.
Administrative division.
The municipality Deskati was formed at the 2011 local government reform by the merger of the following 2 former municipalities, that became municipal units (constituent communities in brackets):
The community of Deskati consists of 4 settlements: <a href="Agios%20Georgios%2C%20Deskati">Agios Georgios</a>, Deskati, <a href="Diasellaki">Diasellaki</a> and <a href="Gilofos">Gilofos</a>.
Geography.
Deskati is located in the southern slopes of <a href="Kamvounia%20mountain">Kamvounia mountain</a>. It is surrounded by mountains covered with <a href="Fir">firs</a>, <a href="Pine">pines</a> and <a href="Oak">oaks</a>. The highest <a href="summit">summit</a> near Deskati is Vounasia (alt. 1,615 m). The community of Deskati covers an area of 126.387 km2, the municipal unit 268.946 km2 and the municipality 431.638 km2.
Economy.
The main occupations in Deskati are <a href="agriculture">agriculture</a>, mainly <a href="wheat">wheat</a> and <a href="tobacco">tobacco</a>, and <a href="animal%20husbandry">animal husbandry</a>. Deskati has 61,790 <a href="Stremma">stremmas</a> of arable land, 24.363 <a href="sheep">sheep</a> and <a href="goats">goats</a> and around 1,000 <a href="cattle">cattle</a>. There are also small industries occupied in <a href="ironwork">ironwork</a>, <a href="marble">marble</a> processing, <a href="woodworking">woodworking</a> and <a href="building%20materials">building materials</a>.
Popular events.
Deskati is famous for its <a href="Andromana%20%28dance%29">Andromana</a>, an event that happens at the end of <a href="spring%20%28season%29">spring</a>, where men stand on each other's shoulders to create a large structure with their bodies. This event is similar to the <a href="Castell">Castell</a>s in <a href="Catalonia">Catalonia</a>, <a href="Spain">Spain</a>.
